title: How to Make White Chocolate Brownies with Chocolate Chips

steps.headline: Line bottom of 9x13 inch (23 x 33 cm) pan with parchment paper.
steps.description: Butter the pan and dust with flour.

steps.headline: Melt white chocolate and butter in a small, heavy saucepan over low heat; stir well to blend.
steps.description: Remove chocolate mixture from heat and let cool.

steps.headline: Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl.
Beat eggs and sugar at high speed with an electric mixer until thick and lemon-colored.
steps.description: Blend in vanilla. Gradually add white chocolate mixture, then flour mixture. Beat well until combined.

steps.headline: Stir in chocolate chips and 1/4 cup almonds.
Spread in prepared pan and sprinkle remaining almonds.
Let cool in pan in a wire rack for 10 minutes, then cut into bars and let cool.

text: Preheat oven to 350°F/180ºC.  Line bottom of 9x13 inch (23 x 33 cm) pan with parchment paper. Butter the pan and dust with flour. Melt white chocolate and butter in a small, heavy saucepan over low heat; stir well to blend. Remove chocolate mixture from heat and let cool. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl. Set aside. Beat eggs and sugar at high speed with an electric mixer until thick and lemon-colored. Blend in vanilla. Gradually add white chocolate mixture, then flour mixture. Beat well until combined. Stir in chocolate chips and 1/4 cup almonds.  Spread in prepared pan and sprinkle remaining almonds. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Let cool in pan in a wire rack for 10 minutes, then cut into bars and let cool.
